name: SlackEX Linux Live DVD

screenshots.caption: Installation in Windows 8.1 to a USB stick

short_description:
SlackEX 14.1 64 bit uses kernel 4.0.4-x86_64-exton and KDE 4.10.5. SlackEX is based on Slackware 14.1, released 131107. Kernel 4.0.4 is the latest stable kernel available from Kernel.org. Released 20150517.

INSTALL TO HARD DRIVE
The system can easily be installed to hard drive (during a live session) using a setup program/script. You can then use Grub2 as bootloader if you want.

USB
SlackEX can be installed to a USB stick in Windows XP/Vista/7/8.1 or in a Linux system. Instruction: http://slackex.exton.net/slackex-14.1-usb.html

PACKAGES
Almost all Slackware 14.1 standard packages are preinstalled in SlackEX 14.1. Also VirtualBox 4.3.28 (so that you can run Windows 8.1 in SlackEX if you feel like it). Study the full package LIST: http://slackex.exton.net/slackex-14.1-installed-packages-150523.txt

NEWS
When you have installed SlackEX on a USB stick all system changes (made by you) will be saved directly (automatically) to the stick. Persistence!
summary: SlackEX 14.1 64 bit is based on Slackware 14.1
